posts.description:
üåé Agree or disagree? "Alex and I were born in the 1980‚Äôs; we were those 8-year-olds who planted trees for Earth Day and worried about alternative fuel sources. But it wasn‚Äôt until adulthood that we realized that the food we eat can also affect the Earth‚Äìin both positive and negative ways. Today we‚Äôre foodies who typically wouldn‚Äôt be caught dead making a dish without of season, non-local tomatoes. We stand in support of our local farmers and against out-of-season, tasteless big-box store tomatoes. However, at the same time:¬†we realize that in order to feed our world, we need diversity in food growing practices. As idealistic as it sounds, we‚Äôre not going to feed the world with 100% local veggie farmers." Your thoughts? More AND this recipe, over on the blog (click the link in profile). .
.
.

NEW: Get Your Greens Pizza recipe! üå±üçï It's a quick and delicious way to get your fresh veg. PLUS an inspiring interview with a local farmer with a passion to put fresh food on the table for ALL people! (Click the link in profile.) The interview and recipe were created for the #FreshFoodMatters series by the fabulous @subzeroandwolf. We are honored to work with a brand passionate about the impact fresh food has on society! A huge thanks to Jonathan Lawler of Brandywine Creek Farms for this interview. .

Kickstarter alert: our friends over at @perennialplate have a 7 more days of Kickstarter to raise funds to create short, positive films of family dinners of immigrant and refugees! We're excited about their shared mission of cultural understanding throughout food. Head over to http://kck.st/2osRbCk for deets. Photo is of me and Larson in our kitchen, where I hope to teach him about food from all cultures, including his own Mexican roots. üì∏ by @kelleyjordanphotography

Can we get a üëäfor who loves #EarthDay? *NEW* recipe to celebrate: chickpea fattoush nourish bowl! üôå It's our new favorite, with chickpeas, crispy pita, juicy tomatoes, and a spiced lemony dressing! All in honor of Earth Day. Recipe is at acouplecooks.com (or click the link on profile), made in partnership with @villagefarms and their sustainably grown tomatoes! üçÖüçÖüçÖ Check out more info about their growing practices in the post. #sponsored

üéâ A very special post is up on the blog: 25 favorite recipes we recommend to people just starting out! I wrote it in response to this reader email below. Check it out over in¬†acouplecooks.com, along with this recipe for Thai Tofu bowls with Peanut Dressing (vegetarian, vegan, gluten-free)! Here is the reader email:

Dear A Couple Cooks, I am emailing for some tips on how to start a plant based diet for my family. Cooking does not come naturally for me. My kids are 5 and 2 and it‚Äôs important to me that we all fix up our eating habits. We eat lots of fruit and mostly chicken and rice is various forms. Vegetables are lacking in our diet other than raw carrots and cucumbers and occasionally some broccoli. Any advice you have that won‚Äôt blow out my budget would be great! ~Catherine M. .
